--- Visit 1 | Date: 2025-06-19 ---

Visit 1 clinical encounter for SB-P007.

VS: 157/110 | HR 54 | Wt 83.1 kg. Patient slightly pale but hemodynamically stable.

No new adverse events reported since last visit.

Labs drawn today:
  - PSA: 7.11 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 12.28 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 11.25 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 11.72 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5] (LOW)
  - WBC: 5.47 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 0.91 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Assessment: Tolerating therapy. Plan to continue protocol. Next visit in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 2 | Date: 2025-07-10 ---

Visit 2 clinical encounter for SB-P007.

Vital signs obtained: blood pressure 143/87, heart rate 67, weight 80.4 kg.

Lab panel results from today's draw:
  - PSA: 6.11 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 12.69 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 11.69 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 11.47 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5] (LOW)
  - WBC: 5.67 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 0.94 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Restaging CT demonstrates complete disappearance of all target lesions. No new lesions. RECIST assessment: Complete Response (CR).

PSA level is 0.66 ng/mL (decrease 86.1% from baseline).

Continue study protocol. Monitor labs. Return visit 3 scheduled in 3 weeks.

Visit 3 clinical encounter for SB-P007.

On exam, BP is 142/84, pulse 58, wt 64.7 kg. Patient appears well-appearing, cooperative with exam.

  - Creatinine: 0.99 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Continue study protocol. Monitor labs. Return visit 4 scheduled in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 4 | Date: 2025-08-21 ---

Routine protocol visit 4. Patient ID: SB-P007.

VS: 130/83 | HR 78 | Wt 82.0 kg. Patient well-nourished and in no acute distress.

No new adverse events reported since last visit.

Routine labs obtained:
  - PSA: 6.25 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 14.21 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 15.61 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 10.93 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5] (LOW)
  - WBC: 5.27 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 1.05 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Restaging CT demonstrates complete disappearance of all target lesions. No new lesions. RECIST assessment: Complete Response (CR).

PSA level is 0.76 ng/mL (decrease 84.1% from baseline).

Continue study protocol. Monitor labs. Return visit 5 scheduled in 3 weeks.

Follow-up visit #5 for patient SB-P007.

Vital signs obtained: blood pressure 120/90, heart rate 77, weight 79.1 kg.

No new adverse events reported since last visit.

Laboratory results:
  - PSA: 5.88 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)

--- Visit 6 | Date: 2025-10-02 ---

Patient SB-P007 presents for scheduled cycle 6 visit.

Vital signs obtained: blood pressure 122/88, heart rate 66, weight 86.6 kg.

No new adverse events reported since last visit.

Labs drawn today:
  - PSA: 4.46 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 15.05 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 14.59 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 10.95 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5] (LOW)
  - WBC: 4.76 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0]
  - Creatinine: 1.0 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

Restaging CT shows stable disease. Target lesions within +/-15% of prior measurements. No new lesions. RECIST: SD.

PSA level is 3.68 ng/mL (decrease 22.6% from baseline).

Plan: Continue current dose. Return for cycle 7 in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 7 | Date: 2025-10-23 ---

Patient SB-P007 presents for scheduled cycle 7 visit.

Vitals: BP 140/70 mmHg, HR 70 bpm, Weight 74.0 kg.

No new adverse events reported since last visit.

Blood work results:
  - PSA: 4.12 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)

Assessment: Tolerating therapy. Plan to continue protocol. Next visit in 3 weeks.

--- Visit 8 | Date: 2025-11-13 ---

Visit 8 clinical encounter for SB-P007.

Vital signs obtained: blood pressure 99/103, heart rate 65, weight 73.9 kg.

No new adverse events reported since last visit.

Lab panel results from today's draw:
  - PSA: 4.5 ng/mL [ref 0.0-4.0] (HIGH)
  - ALT: 20.21 U/L [ref 7.0-56.0]
  - AST: 16.25 U/L [ref 10.0-40.0]
  - Hemoglobin: 10.59 g/dL [ref 12.0-17.5] (LOW)
  - WBC: 4.46 10^3/uL [ref 4.5-11.0] (LOW)
  - Creatinine: 1.06 mg/dL [ref 0.7-1.3]

CT restaging shows partial response. Target lesions reduced significantly (35.7% decrease from baseline). No new lesions identified. RECIST: PR.

Serum PSA: 3.06 ng/mL, representing a decrease of 35.7% compared to baseline.

Plan: Monitor closely and reassess at next visit. Return for cycle 9 in 3 weeks.
